intro: Lepechinia velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf lepechinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush steppe. Lepechinia velutina is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access moisture.
